metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7039 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The IP stack in the Linux kernel through 4.8.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack consumption and panic) or possibly have unspecified other impact by triggering use of the GRO path for large crafted packets, as demonstrated by packets that contain only VLAN headers, a related issue to CVE-2016-8666. Vladimír Beneš discovered an unbounded recursion in the VLAN and TEB Generic Receive Offload (GRO) processing implementations in the Linux kernel, A remote attacker could use this to cause a stack corruption, leading to a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-lowlatency - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-42-generic - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-lowlatency - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-42-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-42-generic - 4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> third break-fix may get split out into a separate CVE.

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1').
